content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1035.5 - Paratransit service for visitors

State Regulations
(a) For purposes of this section, a visitor
is an individual with disabilities who does not reside in the jurisdiction
served by the authority or other entities with which the authority provides
coordinated paratransit service within a region, but who is staying in the
jurisdiction(s) for a temporary period of time. (b) The authority shall treat as eligible for
its paratransit service all visitors who present documentation that they are
ADA-paratransit-eligible, under the criteria of section
1035.2
of this Part, in the
jurisdiction in which they reside. (c) With respect to visitors with
disabilities who do not present such documentation, the authority may require
documentation of the individual's place of residence and, if the individual's
disability is not apparent, of his or her disability. The authority shall
provide paratransit service to individuals with disabilities who qualify as
visitors under subdivision (a) of this section. The authority shall accept a
certification by such individuals that they are unable to use fixed-route
transit. (d) A visitor shall not be
entitled to receive paratransit services for more than 21 days from the date of
the first paratransit trip unless the visitor has applied for and been
determined to be eligible for paratransit under the application process set
forth in section
1035.3
of this

Part. Notes
